raw_text:
Man City 0-2 Man Utd
 
 Manchester United reduced Chelsea's Premiership lead to nine points after a scrappy victory over Manchester City.
 
 Wayne Rooney met Gary Neville's cross to the near post with a low shot, which went in via a deflection off Richard Dunne, to put United ahead. Seven minutes later, the unfortunate Dunne hooked a volley over David James' head and into his own net. Steve McManaman wasted City's best chance when he shot wide from three yards in the first half. In the opening 45 minutes United had looked unlikely to earn the win they needed to maintain any chance of catching Chelsea in the title race. Their approach play was more laboured than patient and they managed to fashion just one chance - a Paul Scholes header over the bar. And City seemed to be content to sit back and try and hit their rivals on the break as the game settled into a tepid pattern. Only Shaun Wright-Phillips appeared capable of interrupting the monotony, looking lively down the right and causing Gabriel Heinze problems.
 
 Wes Brown also found Wright-Phillips to be a difficult opponent when the tricky winger embarrassed him near the touchline. Wright-Phillips' sublime skill and pace took him past Brown and he delivered a pin-point centre to the feet of McManaman. But the former Liverpool player demonstrated why he has never scored against United by side-footing the easy chance wide. John O'Shea was forced off after an earlier clash with Sylvain Distin and Cristiano Ronaldo came on to replace him. He immediately caused Ben Thatcher some discomfort and looked set to inject some much-needed pace into the United attack. Rooney was being well marshalled by Dunne - but that was all about to change. After the break, United poured forward and there was a renewed urgency about their play. And when Neville delivered a cross in a carbon copy of City's best first-half chance, Rooney showed McManaman how to do it - even if he needed the help of Dunne's leg. Worse was to come for Dunne, who had been having a fine match. On 75 minutes, he scored a horrible own goal when attempting to volley clear Rooney's cross and United seemed home and dry. However, City did fight back and Fowler missed another great chance from close range. And United keeper Roy Carroll saved well from Kiki Musampa. But United could have a had a third late on when substitute Ryan Giggs hit the post.
 
 - Manchester City boss Kevin Keegan: "We had a great chance to take the lead and the first goal was always going to be crucial. "We started off with a good tempo but then we allowed them to dictate the pace a bit too much. "But we still had four good chances, two after we'd gone 2-0 down, the one McManaman missed was very similar to the one Wayne Rooney scored from." 
  - Manchester United boss Sir Alex Ferguson: "It wasn't our best performance of the last three months but I think we're deserved winners. "At times, especially in the first half, we didn't play with enough speed. But with (Cristiano) Ronaldo and (Ryan) Giggs on, the speed improved. "Derby games can be like that, they can be scrappy, dull, horrible and it was maybe like that." Man City: James, Mills (Bradley Wright-Phillips 83), Dunne, Distin, Thatcher, Shaun Wright-Phillips, Barton (Macken 68), Sibierski, McManaman, Musampa, Fowler. Subs Not Used: Weaver, Onuoha, Flood. Booked: Fowler, Sibierski. Man Utd: Carroll, Gary Neville, Ferdinand, Brown, Heinze, O'Shea (Ronaldo 33), Keane, Fortune, Fletcher (Giggs 64), Rooney, Scholes (Phil Neville 84). Subs Not Used: Howard, Bellion. Booked: Rooney, Scholes, Keane. Goals: Rooney 68, Dunne 75 og. Att: 47,111 Ref: S Bennett (Kent).
llama3.2:1b:
Manchester United won 0-2 against Manchester City at Old Trafford.

Man Utd led 1-0 with a goal from Wayne Rooney on the hour mark, scoring off Richard Dunne's deflection after Shaun Wright-Phillips' free kick was blocked by Gabriel Heinze. 

In the second half, Man Utd came back to level, with Gary Neville delivering a cross that was headed in by Rooney. However, just before halftime, City took the lead with a goal from David James off a Dunne's volley.

Manchester United scored again on the hour mark after their approach play improved with Cristiano Ronaldo and Ryan Giggs joining the attack. 

The game remained deadlocked until Dunne scored a late own goal for Man Utd, but they still managed to secure a 2-0 win.
llama3.2:3b: Manchester United won 2-0 against Manchester City to reduce Chelsea's Premiership lead to nine points. Wayne Rooney scored the opening goal after a deflection off Richard Dunne, and then a volley by Dunne gave City the lead before halftime. However, United equalized when Rooney met Gary Neville's cross to score again, and then Cristiano Ronaldo added pressure on City's defense. Manchester United eventually won 2-0 with goals from Rooney and an own goal by Richard Dunne in the 75th minute.
gemma2:2b: Manchester United defeated Manchester City 2-0 to close the gap in the Premier League standings. Wayne Rooney scored with a deflection and another goal via an own goal by Richard Dunne gave United an early lead. Though United had chances to capitalize on their advantage, they ultimately outplayed City in the second half, eventually securing victory thanks to a double dose of brilliance from Rooney and a crucial own goal by Richard Dunne. Despite Manchester City's late-game efforts, they failed to overcome the deficit and lose to Manchester United.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Manchester United reduced Chelsea's Premiership lead to nine points after a scrappy victory over Manchester City. Wayne Rooney met Gary Neville's cross to the near post with a low shot that went in via a deflection off Richard Dunne and into his own net. Steve McManaman wasted City's best chance when he shot wide from three yards. In the first half, United had looked unlikely to earn the win they needed to maintain any chance of catching Chelsea in the title race. Their approach play was more laboured than patient, with both teams sitting back and trying their luck until the opening 45 minutes saw a Paul Scholes header over the bar from a long range shot. City seemed content to sit back and try and hit their rivals on the break as the game settled into a tepid pattern. Shaun Wright-Phillips appeared capable of interrupting the monotony, looking lively down the right and causing Gabriel Heinze problems. Wes Brown also found Wright-Phillips challenging when he embarrassed him near the touchline. The final 24 minutes saw United pouring forward and with Cristiano Ronaldo replacing Rooney at 63rd minute, they managed to score two goals in a row - one from Kiki Musampa and another from Ryan Giggs.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Manchester United defeated Manchester City 2-0 to secure a nine-point lead over Chelsea in the Premier League title race after reducing Chelsea's advantage by one point following a scrappy victory. Wayne Rooney scored two goals from crosses and free-kicks off Richard Dunne, with Paul Scholes missing an opportunity early on for Manchester United. The match highlighted the contrasting approaches of City and United; while City had dominated possession play, Manchester United showed improvement in second half attacks.
qwen2.5:3b: Man Utd defeated Man City 2-0 in a scrappy match that reduced Chelsea's Premier League lead to nine points. Wayne Rooney scored the opening goal via a deflected cross from Gary Neville and followed it with an own goal from Dunne seven minutes later. Steve McManaman missed a chance early, but United improved their play after halftime. John O'Shea was replaced by Cristiano Ronaldo, who provided pace. The game ended 2-0, with Rooney scoring again on a Dunne deflection and a late substitute goal from Ryan Giggs. Man City's Kevin Keegan criticized their lack of speed, while Man Utd's Sir Alex Ferguson noted the improvement in speed with attacking players like Ronaldo and Giggs.
opencoder:1.5b:
Manchester City had a fantastic win over the likes of Manchester United against The City on a Friday night as they struggled to maintain a lead in their title race.

United came close with a clear finish and scored a point on the試合. However, City's performance was mixed, resulting in a penalty draw which ended the game.

In the first half, Rooney scored a cross over Gary Neville and David James. The goal came from Wayne Rooney who used a low shot to navigate into the midfield.

McManaman took it to the finish line with his own cross. He hit a good shot on the bar and then managed to get the ball in the opponent's net. The game struggled, but they also needed more chances.

The United player, Paul Scholes, scored from the corner back after a fantastic tackle by Shaun Wright-Phillips who was playing with his side. This helped to generate more opportunities for City later in the game.

City also had a good chance of catching a substitute on the break, who was Daniel O'Neill. He took it to the ball and then managed to hit the goalkeeper with a fine stroke.

Rooney, who needed a second late on, got a clear goal against City with his own cross. The United player, Bill Artz, took it to the finish line which generated more opportunities for City.

The United keeper, Roy Carroll, allowed Kiki Musampa to save them. The City goalkeeper, Brendan Wright-Phillips, also had a shot in the penalty box and a point.

Wes Brown also caught Wright-Phillips who was looking lively down the right and causing problems for City's goalkeeper, who is David Souto.

The United had been struggling with injuries and other issues, but they managed to recover from the past few games. They scored two goals in their first half and four goals in the total match.

In the end, City showed a remarkable performance that made them stronger than ever before. They scored more goals than any other player and won a game against United on a Friday night.

tinyllama:1.1b: Manchester United recorded a crucial victory against Manchester City by scoring two late goals and preventing them from securing the title race with Chelsea on top. Wayne Rooney scored twice to provide the win, including a low shot that went in via a deflection off Richard Dunne, and Steve McManaman wasted an opportunity to interrupt the monotony of the game. United's approach play was more laborious than patient, resulting in only one chaos chance from a pass from Wes Brown, while City struggled to create any significant attacks due to sloppy passing, lacking pace, and poor finishing. Despite conceding second-half goals, Manchester United maintained their lead over Manchester City by improving their attack play with the help of Cristiano Ronaldo's late intervention. The game was marked by Manchester United's improved chaçcch play and better attacking efficiency after a frustrating first half when they failed to make any significant attempts at goal.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Manchester City were dealt a blow in the second half as their lead against Manchester United was reduced to just two points after Wayne Rooney's goal. However, they managed to hold on for a 2-0 win and maintained their grip on first place in the Premier League table.
phi:2.7b: Manchester United defeated Manchester City 0-2 in the FA Premier League to reduce Chelsea's lead in the title race to nine points. Wayne Rooney scored two goals for United, including a low shot from a cross by Gary Neville and a header from a deflected volley by Richard Dunne. Cristiano Ronaldo was red carded for a foul on Paul Scholes, who had just scored the second goal. The game was dominated by United's possession, but City also created some chances. Manchester City manager Kevin Keegan said they needed to improve their tempo and take more risks in future games. Manchester United's Alex Ferguson praised his team's performance but admitted it was not as good as he would have liked.
orca-mini:3b: Manchester City were reduced to nine points by Manchester United with a scrappy victory in the Premier League. Wayne Rooney scored twice for United, including a goal after an own-goal by Richard Dunne, and was well marshaled by Ben Thatcher. Cristiano Ronaldo and Ryan Giggs made their debuts for the visitors. Kevin Keegan praised the performance of his team but Sir Alex Ferguson praised his own team's performance, despite not playing with enough speed in the first half.
hermes3:3b: Manchester Utd beat Man City 2-0 in a match, reducing Chelsea's lead to 9 points. Wayne Rooney scored first, then Richard Dunne scored an own goal.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Manchester United won against Manchester City with a score of 0-2 in the Premier League. Wayne Rooney scored the first goal via a deflection off Richard Dunne, and later on, Dunne accidentally scored an own goal when trying to clear Rooney's cross. Manchester City had a chance to take the lead but missed it, and United sealed their victory with a win after an improved performance in the second half. Both teams' managers commented on the scrappy nature of the game.
stablelm2:1.6b: Manchester United defeated Manchester City 2-0 in a tense match as Wayne Rooney scored the first goal via a deflection off Richard Dunne and then scored another own goal after Dunne attempted to clear his cross. This victory reduced Chelsea's lead by nine points in the Premiership race.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Manchester United secured a 2-0 victory over Manchester City, reducing Chelsea's Premiership lead to nine points. Wayne Rooney scored the first goal with a deflected low shot, and Dunne own-gave the second. Despite City's best chances, including one from Steve McManaman and an almost certain goal by Fowler, they failed to capitalize. United improved in the second half, with Cristiano Ronaldo injecting pace into their attack and Rooney demonstrating how to convert similar opportunities. Dunne scored a controversial own goal on 75 minutes, sealing the win for Manchester United. City's manager, Kevin Keegan, criticized his team's ability to maintain momentum, while Sir Alex Ferguson praised their resilience and the impact of Ronaldo and Giggs. The match saw 47,111 spectators at a capacity stadium.
